title: The Creative Economy

ARTS + CULTURE, COMMUNITY, ENTERTAINMENT

title: Beta Stage
description:
ARTS + CULTURE, ENTERTAINMENT


Join The Butch and The Bi for an evening of stand up from Tyler Ray Kendrick and Zach Funk, improv and sketch featuring some of Pittsburgh’s funniest performers, music from Brian Adams, and more! Featuring stand up comedy from Tyler Ray Kendrick and Zach Funk, music from Winchester Ghost’s Brian Adams, and some of Pittsburgh’s funniest improvisors!

title: Well Known Strangers
description:
ARTS + CULTURE, ENTERTAINMENT, NIGHTLIFE


Experienced improvisers  get a suggestion from the audience to inspire laugh-out-loud stories and characters. Don’t miss this night of clever and absurd scenes by this fun-loving team of goofs.

title: Knights of the Arcade: Epic D&D Adventure
description:
ARTS + CULTURE, ENTERTAINMENT, NIGHTLIFE


Join Knights of the Arcade for another hilarious D&D comedy adventure! One of Pittsburgh’s longest running and best-selling comedy shows! A recurring cast of characters are joined by special guests and led by their maniacal dungeon master. Where they’re going, who they fight, and if they ultimately succeed is decided upon live dice that are rolled and projected on the theater wall.

title: 2025 Star Dance Alliance
description:
CONVENTION, SPORTS + RECREATION


Dancers will showcase their best moves at the Revolution Talent Competition in Pittsburgh.

title: Storm Large: Inside Voice
description:
ARTS + CULTURE, ENTERTAINMENT


International icon and multi-hyphenate musician, actor, playwright and performer, Storm Large has affixed herself as the queen of twisted beauty & subversive delights to a cult-like following of millions across the page, stage & screen.

title: Pittsburgh Riverhounds vs Birmingham Legion
description:
ENTERTAINMENT, SPORTS + RECREATION


Join us at Highmark Stadium on Saturday, March 29, as we celebrate Pittsburgh Night and cheer on the Riverhounds when they take on Birmingham Legion under the lights!

title: Zoso - The Ultimate Led Zeppelin Experience
description:
ARTS + CULTURE, ENTERTAINMENT, MUSIC


The most accurate and captivating Led Zeppelin live show since the real thing.

Ignite your Friday nights at 7 pm with Arcade Comedy Theater’s ! Our talented house teams will light up the stage with spontaneous hilarity, quick-witted banter, and scenes that are sure to leave you in stitches.

title: Select Start Improv Show
description:
ARTS + CULTURE, ENTERTAINMENT, NIGHTLIFE


Get ready for another unforgettable night at City Paper’s Best Theater in PGH of 2024, Arcade Comedy Theater —where comedy titans, Select Start (City Paper’s 2 time Best Comedy Act) and Latchkey Kids (Pittsburgh Magazine’s 3 time Best Improv Team), will join forces with Chi Chi de Vivre (City Paper’s Best Drag Performer 2024) to celebrate all of their 2024 victories!

title: Danae Hays: The First Time Tour
description:
ARTS + CULTURE, ENTERTAINMENT, NIGHTLIFE


Alabama-bred and Nashville-based, comedian, actress, and content creator, Danae Hays represents a fresh, new female voice in the comedy, acting, and music worlds.

title: Danae Hays VIP Package
description:
ARTS + CULTURE, ENTERTAINMENT, NIGHTLIFE


Gain exclusive access to the post-show Q&A with Danae Hays. EACH ATTENDEE must hold a valid show ticket, in any price category to Danae Hays: The First Time Tour AND pre-purchase a VIP Package ticket to attend.

title: Library Lounge: Coffee Hour
description: Join us for a fun and engaging social program!

title: Let’s Speak English!
description:
COMMUNITY, WORKSHOPS & CLASSES


Join us to practice your English-speaking skills! You can freely practice with friendly neighbors in this relaxed social group.

title: IIDA Pittsburgh Fashion Meets Finish
description:
ARTS + CULTURE, COMMUNITY


Get ready to witness the perfect fusion of fashion and finishes at the  event!

title: Beethoven’s Pastoral
description:
ARTS + CULTURE, ENTERTAINMENT, MUSIC


The PSO’s season features works inspired by the natural world: Beethoven’s “Pastoral” you can hear bucolic bird calls, the rolling of thunder, and the calling of a shepherd’s pipes from distant hills. Habibi’s new work was written as a meditation on climate change. Eisendle’s Heliosis, from the Greek word for the sun, is in turn blistering, scorching, and shimmering.

title: Tyler, The Creator
description:
ENTERTAINMENT, MUSIC, NIGHTLIFE


Watch  perform live at PPG Paints Arena on the CHROMAKOPIA: THE WORLD TOUR!

title: Traffic Club of Pittsburgh 2025
description: The Traffic Club of Pittsburgh organizes a wide array of recreational, educational and social events throughout the year to keep the transportation community updated and reward individuals that excel in their fields.

title: The Yellowjackets
description:
ARTS + CULTURE, ENTERTAINMENT, MUSIC


Throughout their storied 43-year history, the Yellowjackets have recorded 26 albums, received 16 Grammy® nominations – won 2 – performed countless sold-out tours, and enjoyed worldwide critical acclaim and commercial success.

title: Prismatic Impressions
description:
ARTS + CULTURE, ENTERTAINMENT


Ballet Legato presents “”, a colorful array of repertoire bringing the audience an eclectic prism of dance!

title: 2025 GFS Show
description: The Gordon Food Service Show will feature a wide array of products, foods, and technology solutions. At the show, attendees will have the chance to sample tasty menus, learn to cook and prepare delicious plates, and gain valuable knowledge in how to handle new technology. Attendees will also take away a plethora of tips and tricks meant to bring a whole new level of efficiency to your business and productivity in the kitchen.

title: Speakers Series: Chris Wallace
description:
COMMUNITY, WORKSHOPS & CLASSES


Award-winning television anchor and commentator, Wallace’s career on ABC,?NBC,?Fox News, and?CNN spans five decades. He anchored Fox News Sunday for 18 years, and has interviewed everyone from Vladimir Putin to George Clooney to Bill Gates. He is currently host of The Chris Wallace Show.

title: An Evening with Rob Zellers
description: Join us for an intimate reading and conversation with esteemed playwright Rob Zellers (The Chief, Billy Strayhorn: Something to Live For, Harry’s Friendly Service) as he explores how inspiration and loss intertwine in his newest play that maps the parallel paths of his evolution as an artist and his daughter Alexa’s battle with illness.

title: 12 Ophelias (a play with broken songs)
description:
ARTS + CULTURE, ENTERTAINMENT, MUSIC


Shakespeare’s Ophelia rises up out of the water dreaming of Pop-Tarts and other sweet things. She finds herself in a neo-Elizabethan Appalachian setting where Gertrude runs a brothel, Hamlet is called a Rude Boy, and nothing is what it seems. In this mirrored world of word-scraps, Ophelia cuts a new path for herself.

title: An Evening with Gregory Alan Isakov
description:
ENTERTAINMENT, MUSIC


$1 from the sale of each ticket purchased will be donated to Greater Pittsburgh Community Food Bank, who are leveraging the power of community to achieve lasting solutions to hunger and its root causes. Every $1 donated results in providing 3 meals to the those in need.

title: Sound Series: Flore Laurentienne with special guest GLO-TREE
description:
ENTERTAINMENT, MUSIC, NIGHTLIFE


We welcome Flore Laurentienne, the lush orchestral soundscape project of Mathieu David Gagnon – the Canadian composer, producer, and multi-instrumentalist whose expansive string orchestrations and experimentation with early analogue synths reflect the natural environment of his native Québec.

title: Lucky Draw
description:
ARTS + CULTURE, ENTERTAINMENT


Join us on the fourth Sunday of each month for ! This is an interactive improv comedy show where half of the cast is drawn on the spot at random. Arcade’s Academy students, team members, or any other improvisers can put their names into the box and be picked to come on stage to play.

title: Desi Banks: The Elevation Tour
description:
ARTS + CULTURE, ENTERTAINMENT, NIGHTLIFE


Desi Banks is the ultimate triple threat – actor, stand-up comedian, podcaster, and entrepreneur who's taking the entertainment world by storm.

title: Kanneh-Mason Performs Shostakovich
description:
ARTS + CULTURE, ENTERTAINMENT, MUSIC


One of the most gifted young artists onstage today, Sheku Kanneh-Mason catapulted to international fame with his performance at the wedding of Prince Harry and Meghan Markle. He makes his Pittsburgh Symphony debut with Shostakovich’s First Cello Concerto. Nina Shekhar’s new work “explodes like an orchestral supernova” (LA Times). The program is rounded out with two wonderfully passionate works by Strauss.

title: Under the Radar
description:
ARTS + CULTURE, ENTERTAINMENT


Once a month, local independent improv teams come together and take over Arcade’s stage for a once in a lifetime lineup!

title: Madama Butterfly
description:
ARTS + CULTURE, ENTERTAINMENT


His escape is her cage. In this groundbreaking new production created by an all-Japanese and Japanese American creative team, ’s story is transported to a fantastical realm where reality and dreams intersect.

title: Champion Cheer Central 2025
description:
CONVENTION, SPORTS + RECREATION


Teams will compete at the Oh! How Sweet it is! Cheer and Dance Spectacular!

title: Captain's Dinner Cruise & Tour
description: Looking for a fun and unique evening out in Pittsburgh? Come aboard our Captain’s Dinner Cruise & Tour for a fabulous dinner, music and dancing and fabulous views of the city skyline! Bring a date, a group of friends, or the whole family and just have fun out on the water in Pittsburgh!

title: Penguin-Palooza
description: Waddle on over to the National Aviary and celebrate everyone’s favorite flightless feathered friends: penguins! Meet the colony of African Penguins in Penguin Point, watch a fun feeding and chat with National Aviary experts, find out what makes penguins so unique, make your own penguin craft, and more. Learn how you can help penguins and other marine life every day.

title: "The Neon Queen"-Live ABBA cover band at the Mamma Mia Bar-Pittsburgh
description:
ENTERTAINMENT, MUSIC, NIGHTLIFE


The Mamma Mia Bar-Pittsburgh is back! And so is one of our favorite Abba cover bands-'The Neon Queen"!

title: Matt Rife
description:
ENTERTAINMENT, NIGHTLIFE


Watch  perform live at PPG Paints Arena on his Stay Golden Tour!

title: Pittsburgh Riverhounds vs Hartford Athletic
description:
ENTERTAINMENT, SPORTS + RECREATION


The wait is over—Riverhounds soccer is back! Join us at Highmark Stadium on Saturday, March 22, as Pittsburgh Riverhounds SC takes on Hartford Athletic in an electrifying home opener!

title: Crankdat
description:
ENTERTAINMENT, MUSIC, NIGHTLIFE


With special guests YDG and CELO!

title: Brandee Younger Trio
description:
ARTS + CULTURE, ENTERTAINMENT


Ever-expanding as an artist, Brandee has worked with cultural icons including Common, Lauryn Hill, and John Legend. Brandee Younger made history by becoming the first Black woman to be nominated for a Grammy Award for Best Instrumental Composition. She has curated a number of performances dedicated to honoring the work of Dorothy Ashby and Alice Coltrane.

title: Charcuterie Workshop at PAIR
description:
ARTS + CULTURE, COMMUNITY


Gather your girls, bring your man, and don’t forget a bottle! Join us for a hands-on Charcuterie Workshop, where you'll craft a beautiful and delicious spread while enjoying light bites and great company.

title: House Team Hot Spot
description:
ARTS + CULTURE, ENTERTAINMENT


Ignite your Friday nights at 7 pm with Arcade Comedy Theater’s ! Our talented house teams will light up the stage with spontaneous hilarity, quick-witted banter, and scenes that are sure to leave you in stitches. Come see why these performers are the heartbeat of Pittsburgh’s comedy scene as they turn your wild suggestions into unforgettable moments of pure comedic gold. Don’t miss out on the laughs—grab your tickets now and fill your Friday with fiery fun!

title: Jeremy Piven Live
description:
ARTS + CULTURE, ENTERTAINMENT, NIGHTLIFE


Piven now tours the country with his successful stand-up comedy show, flexing a comedic muscle that few actors have been able to transition over to. The tour will see him across the entire continental U.S. and also take him internationally to the U.K. and beyond.

title: Jeremy Piven VIP Meet & Greet
description:
ARTS + CULTURE, ENTERTAINMENT, NIGHTLIFE


JEREMY PIVEN LIVE VIP Meet & Greet Add-On: Includes a POST-SHOW Meet & Greet and photo with Jeremy Piven.

title: Let’s Speak English!
description:
COMMUNITY, WORKSHOPS & CLASSES


Join us to practice your English-speaking skills! You can freely practice with friendly neighbors in this relaxed social group.

title: 2025-For Inspiration and Recognition of Science and Technology (FIRST)
description: At the Western & Central Pennsylvania FIRST Robotic Competition, 48 teams will showcase their best inventions and compete for the title. Check our website to learn more!

description:
ARTS + CULTURE, ENTERTAINMENT, MUSIC


One of the most gifted young artists onstage today, Sheku Kanneh-Mason catapulted to international fame with his performance at the wedding of Prince Harry and Meghan Markle. He makes his Pittsburgh Symphony debut with Shostakovich’s First Cello Concerto. Nina Shekhar’s new work “explodes like an orchestral supernova” (LA Times). The program is rounded out with two wonderfully passionate works by Strauss.

ENTERTAINMENT, SPORTS + RECREATION


Cheer on the Pittsburgh Penguins as they take on the Columbus Blue Jackets!

description:
ARTS + CULTURE, ENTERTAINMENT


The grand finale of The Thaw brings a fiery celebration of music and a ceremonial snowman burning to welcome the first days of spring. This high-energy weekend features live music, fire pits, and stunning fire performances.

title: The Network Factory IX: Neighbor to Neighbor
description:
COMMUNITY, WORKSHOPS & CLASSES


Join The Warhol Academy as some of Pittsburgh’s brightest minds in business, art, and community development come together for a dynamic discussion on shaping our city’s future.

description:
ARTS + CULTURE, ENTERTAINMENT, MUSIC


With a mix of cheeky Irish charm, stellar vocals from some of the country's most renowned stars, and electrifying multi-instrumental performances, audiences of all ages are invited to experience the Emerald Isle like never before.

title: International Seating Symposium
description: The  2025 is a premier event geared toward researchers, clinicians, manufacturers, and other professionals involved in improving mobility and seating for people with disabilities.

description:
COMMUNITY, WORKSHOPS & CLASSES


Join us for an inspiring conversation with Joe Grushecky, acclaimed Pittsburgh musician and educator, as he shares his journey of keeping his passion for music alive.

description:
COMMUNITY, WORKSHOPS & CLASSES


Join us for a lively discussion on “The Bookshop: A History of the American Bookstore by Evan Friss.”

description:
ARTS + CULTURE, ENTERTAINMENT, MUSIC


Superstar Lang Lang, named “the hottest artist on the classical music planet,” by The New York Times, returns to Heinz Hall to perform the Grieg Piano Concerto in this one-night-only evening of piano pyrotechnics. Additional program details to be announced.

title: Spotlight on the ‘Burgh: Whose Trick is it Anyway?
description:
ARTS + CULTURE, ENTERTAINMENT


Back by popular demand: the best of the ‘Burgh! An improvisational magic show like none other! That’s right, it’s Spotlight on the Burgh’s original feature, Whose Trick is it Anyway? Where everything is made up and the points don't matter. That's right, the points are like volume of Teller’s microphone.

title: Who's Afraid of Virginia Woolf?
description:
ARTS + CULTURE, ENTERTAINMENT


It’s all fun and games until the one and only Edward Albee picks up his pen. His 1962 masterpiece WHO’S AFRAID OF VIRGINIA WOOLF? is a caustic cocktail of razor-sharp dialogue and electrifying performances that has kept audiences coming back for another round for decades.

title: Library Lounge: Movie Matinee
description:
ARTS + CULTURE, ENTERTAINMENT, FILM & MOVIES


Join us for a movie screening of “The Eyes of Tammy Faye.”

title: Jason Kush
description:
ARTS + CULTURE, ENTERTAINMENT, MUSIC


A genre-crossing performer, Kush is a member of the Pittsburgh Jazz Orchestra and has performed thirteen seasons with the Pittsburgh Symphony Orchestra, including a European tour.

title: Penguins vs. Islanders
description:
ENTERTAINMENT, SPORTS + RECREATION


Cheer on the Pittsburgh Penguins as they take on the New York Islanders!

title: Visit The Old Allegheny County Jail and Museum
description:
FREE EVENT, TOURS


Take a free trip!

title: Short Form Jelly with Select Start
description:
ARTS + CULTURE, ENTERTAINMENT


Join comedy troupe Select Start as they host a short form improv jam open to all performers! Join them on stage for a night of improv games. Performers can sign up at the box office when they arrive. Audience members can sit back, laugh, and inspire the comedy with all kinds of fun suggestions.

title: Alton Brown Live: Last Bite
description:
ARTS + CULTURE, ENTERTAINMENT


, the famed foodist reflects on his decades in food media, presents several of his favorite culinary mega-hacks, sings some of his funny food songs, and in general offers a culinary variety show the likes of which human eyes have never seen.

title: National History Day Pittsburgh
description: Join the History Center for the region’s National History Day competition.

title: Dinner with The Nolens
description:
ARTS + CULTURE, ENTERTAINMENT


Comedy is what’s on the menu!

title: Unique: An Improv Show About Disabilities and Mental Health
description:
ARTS + CULTURE, COMMUNITY, ENTERTAINMENT


Join us for a hilarious night of anecdotes and improv provided by storytellers and performers who have two things in common: each is UNIQUE, and they all have disabilities!

title: Black in Bloom: Spring Community Day
description: Bring your friends and family to explore our Spring Vendor Market, enjoy live DJ sets, experience performances from local artists, and discover a wealth of resources and activities for all ages. Step into Spring with us, celebrating the strength and resilience that surrounds us!

title: Guided Tour with Urban Academy – August Wilson: The Writer’s Landscape
description:
COMMUNITY, TOURS


Experience the Enduring Legacy of August Wilson with Special Guided Tours Lead by Urban Academy K-5 Students.

title: Library Lounge: Throwback Cinema
description:
ARTS + CULTURE, ENTERTAINMENT, FILM & MOVIES


Join us for a movie screening of “Kramer vs. Kramer.” All movies selected will be at least 20 years old.

title: Pittsburgh St. Patrick's Day Parade
description:
FESTIVAL, HOLIDAYS


What began more than 150 years ago as a way to honor the patron saint of Ireland has evolved into a city-wide celebration of the pride that comes from being Irish. We welcome you to join us, first for mass at Old St. Patrick’s in the Strip, and then along the parade route. Wear your green (or black and gold), and help us celebrate!

title: Pittsburgh Parade Day Dash
description:
HOLIDAYS, SPORTS + RECREATION


Lace up your sneakers, put on your green, and get ready to MOVE! P3R is excited to unveil the inaugural  Presented by GNC, a vibrant and family-friendly celebration happening on March 15, just before the start of Pittsburgh’s iconic America’s Grand St. Patrick’s Day Event!

title: Kegs N' Eggs at City Works Pittsburgh
description:
COMMUNITY, HOLIDAYS


Join us bright and early on March 15 for the best St. Patrick's Day shenanigans in Pittsburgh. That’s right, Kegs N' Eggs is back and better than ever. It’s the ultimate pre-parade party that'll have you sham-rocking in the wee morning hours.

title: Lift Every Voice
description:
ARTS + CULTURE, ENTERTAINMENT, MUSIC


Join Ray Angry, keyboardist of The Roots,  Unity Choir led by Nikki Porter, and the Pittsburgh Symphony Orchestra for this annual concert paying tribute to the spirit, joy, and richness of Black music in America. The concert also features PSO's Paul J. Ross Fellow Joshua Carr on trumpet, and PSO Associate Conductor Moon Doh.

title: National History Day Pittsburgh
description: Join the History Center for the region’s National History Day competition.

title: Penguins vs. Devils
description:
ENTERTAINMENT, SPORTS + RECREATION


Cheer on the Pittsburgh Penguins as they take on the New Jersey Devils!

title: LGBTQ+/Ally Night
description:
ARTS + CULTURE, COMMUNITY


Raise a glass and support a good cause! Join the Pittsburgh Opera New Guard for  at opening night of Madama Butterfly on March 22nd at the Benedum Center.

title: The Thaw: Weekend 2
description:
COMMUNITY, ENTERTAINMENT


Opening at 5pm on Saturday, March 15, a celebration of Irish culture and music takes over Market Square, with performances from the best local Irish bands. With Irish whiskey tastings, an authentic ‘Pub On The Square’, and a pop-up cocktail lounge, this weekend promises to be a blarney good time!

title: Meet Mario, the new director of The Warhol
description: Mario Rossero invites you to a fun-filled meet and greet as he begins his new role at the museum. Join us for music by DJ Mary Mack, artmaking, a cash bar featuring Mario Manhattans, and a few surprises along the way. It also happens to be his 50th birthday, so join us for a birthday cupcake as well! The museum will remain open with free admission until 10 p.m.

title: House Team Hot Spot
description:
ARTS + CULTURE, ENTERTAINMENT


Ignite your Friday nights at 7 pm with Arcade Comedy Theater’s ! Our talented house teams will light up the stage with spontaneous hilarity, quick-witted banter, and scenes that are sure to leave you in stitches.

title: The Latchkey Kids
description:
ARTS + CULTURE, ENTERTAINMENT, NIGHTLIFE


 return for the season premiere of their award-winning improv show. Join the middle children of improv as they spin comedy gold from old public access videos and dollar-bin VHS trash!

title: Annie
description:
ARTS + CULTURE, ENTERTAINMENT


Holding onto hope when times are tough can take an awful lot of determination, and sometimes, an awful lot of determination comes in a surprisingly small package. Little Orphan  has reminded generations of theatergoers that sunshine is always right around the corner, and now the best-loved musical of all time is set to return in a new production – just as you remember it and just when we need it most.

title: Annie - Broadway Talk Back Series
description:
ARTS + CULTURE, ENTERTAINMENT, WORKSHOPS & CLASSES


On select days, immediately following the performance, grab a seat up close, and join us for a lively post-show discussion with cast and/or members of the show’s creative team. You don’t want to miss this fantastic opportunity to dive deeper into your Broadway experience.

title: Coffee + Connect
description: Join us to enjoy some coffee and snacks and meet a representative from a local community organization to learn more about their services.

title: Let’s Speak English!
description:
COMMUNITY, WORKSHOPS & CLASSES


Join us to practice your English-speaking skills! You can freely practice with friendly neighbors in this relaxed social group.

title: Universal Language
description:
ARTS + CULTURE, ENTERTAINMENT, FILM & MOVIES


In a mysterious and surreal interzone somewhere between Tehran and Winnipeg, the lives of multiple characters interweave in surprising and mysterious ways. Space, time and personal identities crossfade and echo into a surreal comedy of misdirection.

title: Sound in Motion
description:
ARTS + CULTURE, ENTERTAINMENT


Texture Contemporary Ballet’s 14th season culminates in , a captivating exploration of the interplay between movement and music. Prepare for a live-music collaboration that ignites the stage: Artistic Director Alan Obuzor joins forces with Pittsburgh-based musician, D.o.B., fusing edgy R&B music with the raw power and artistry of Texture’s dancers.

title: Faith Builders Education Programs- 2025 REACH
description: REACH facilitates the connection between nonprofit ministries, churches, and individuals seeking information about these ministries.

title: Penguins vs. Blues
description:
ENTERTAINMENT, SPORTS + RECREATION


Cheer on the Pittsburgh Penguins as they take on the St. Louis Blues!

title: Pretty Guardian Sailor Moon: The Super Live
description:
ARTS + CULTURE, ENTERTAINMENT


Prepare to be enchanted! "," the groundbreaking 2.5D musical, is bringing the iconic “Sailor Moon” world to life like never before. This stunning stage adaptation—based on the legendary manga and anime—transports audiences into a dazzling world of friendship and justice with its electrifying performances, unforgettable choreography and show-stopping music.

title: Three Rivers Readers Book Club
description:
COMMUNITY, WORKSHOPS & CLASSES


Join us for a lively discussion on From the Furnace, With Love by Jason Kirin. Title selections will include genre books including memoirs, plays, poetry, photobooks, and novels. Attendees are welcome to join in-person or virtually using the link provided in your RSVP confirmation email.

title: Penguins vs. Knights
description:
ENTERTAINMENT, SPORTS + RECREATION


Cheer on the Pittsburgh Penguins as they take on the Vegas Golden Knights!

title: Stephanie J. Block
description:
ARTS + CULTURE, ENTERTAINMENT


Established as one of theater’s most relevant and versatile voices, Block boasts an impressive career with credits including Into the Woods, Sunset Boulevard, The Cher Show (Tony®, Lead Actress), Falsettos, The Mystery of Edwin Drood, Anything Goes, 9 to 5, The Pirate Queen, The Boy From Oz, and originating the role of Elphaba in the first national tour of Wicked.

title: Pittsburgh Improv Jam with Well Known Strangers
description:
ARTS + CULTURE, ENTERTAINMENT


Join the Well Known Strangers as they host the Pittsburgh Improv Jam, a now-monthly jam presented at the Arcade Comedy Theater and open to all performers! Each month, performers can sign up to be randomly placed on an improv ensemble team that will exist for just one night only.

title: Highland Heroes & Hexes Boat Tour
description:
FAMILY, TOURS


Join us for a day of archery, music and curses, where you, the audience, become part of the tale. Can you help our heroes save the day? Embark with us on an interactive adventure unlike any other, Highlander Heroes & Hexes awaits!

title: Lisiecki Performs Mozart
description:
ARTS + CULTURE, ENTERTAINMENT, MUSIC


Praised for his "pristine, lyrical and intelligent" playing (The New York Times), Jan Lisiecki returns to perform Mozart’s elegant and effervescent piano concerto. Prokofiev’s Fifth Symphony is filled with grand, sweeping, lyrical music tinged with brooding introspection.

title: Arcade Hootenanny
description:
ARTS + CULTURE, ENTERTAINMENT


The  is styled after the classic Chicago-style improv show featuring monologist-inspired scenes. A storyteller tells real-life tales and improvisers present a fast & funny set inspired by elements from the story.

title: CoWorkers
description:
ARTS + CULTURE, ENTERTAINMENT


Arcade Comedy Theater invites you to invites you to peek behind the curtain at the lives of the people you work with. Combining short-form and long-form improv to create a full-length narrative show of the most exciting kind of entertainment…Middle Management Improv!

title: Comedy Confidential
description:
ARTS + CULTURE, ENTERTAINMENT, NIGHTLIFE


Arcade Comedy Theater presents , a showcase of Pittsburgh’s brightest comedic talents!

title: Kimberly Akimbo - Broadway Talk Back Series
description:
ARTS + CULTURE, ENTERTAINMENT, WORKSHOPS & CLASSES


On select days, immediately following the performance, grab a seat up close, and join us for a lively post-show discussion with cast and/or members of the show’s creative team. You don’t want to miss this fantastic opportunity to dive deeper into your Broadway experience.

title: Cookbook Club: Strange Eats
description:
COMMUNITY, WORKSHOPS & CLASSES


Join us for a new cookbook club with the Library! At select CLP locations, we will talk cookbooks, share stories and cultures and explore all things culinary. This month’s theme will be Strange Eats.

title: Early Hearing Detection Intervention (EHDI) Meeting 2025
description: The EHDI Conference aims at enhancing the implementation of comprehensive EHDI programs at the state level.

title: PSO Disrupt: Hope and Resistance
description:
ARTS + CULTURE, COMMUNITY, ENTERTAINMENT, MUSIC


Forget everything you’ve heard. Join the PSO at Heinz Hall for one-of-a-kind experiences that take you deeper into the music. Whether you’re new to classical music or just want to explore the music in a new way, expect moments of fascination, guided from the stage. This performance featres Prokofiev's Symphony No. 5.

title: Speaker Saturday: “William Trent: Factor of Ambition”
description:
COMMUNITY, WORKSHOPS & CLASSES


Join Fort Pitt Museum for an afternoon with author Jason A. Cherry.

title: International Art House Classics: M (1931) 35mm
description:
ARTS + CULTURE, ENTERTAINMENT, FILM & MOVIES


One of the greatest films of all time, Fritz Lang's M revolutionized the medium with its inventive soundscape, acute social commentary, and stunning visuals.

title: The Thaw: Weekend 1
description:
COMMUNITY, ENTERTAINMENT, FAMILY


Family-friendly by day, music-driven by night, the first weekend of The Thaw celebrates the magic of ice and snow. Market Square will come alive with awe-inspiring ice sculptures, live carvings, and an 18-foot ice luge for kids. Celebrate all the magic of winter – before we show it the door!

title: House Team Hot Spot
description:
ARTS + CULTURE, ENTERTAINMENT


Ignite your Friday nights at 7 pm with Arcade Comedy Theater’s ! Our talented house teams will light up the stage with spontaneous hilarity, quick-witted banter, and scenes that are sure to leave you in stitches.

title: Level Up Stand Up
description:
ARTS + CULTURE, ENTERTAINMENT, NIGHTLIFE


Get ready to laugh like never before at Arcade Comedy Theater’s electrifying Level Up Stand-Up showcase!

title: Let’s Speak English!
description:
COMMUNITY, WORKSHOPS & CLASSES


Join us to practice your English-speaking skills! You can freely practice with friendly neighbors in this relaxed social group.

title: Let’s Read English!
description:
COMMUNITY, WORKSHOPS & CLASSES


Join us to practice your English-reading skills! We will read and discuss the short story “The Story of My Life in 3,500 Words or Less” by Nora Ephron together.

title: Postpartum Pittsburgh Spring Conference 2025
description: The 2025 Spring Conference will bring together a diverse audience of healthcare providers, mental health professionals, and stakeholders, all dedicated to advancing perinatal mental health!

title: 2025 Pittsburgh Home and Garden Show
description: Join us for the Pittsburgh Garden & Home Show and take advantage of a great opportunity to browse displays from hundreds of exhibitors showcasing a wide array of products and services designed to add value to your home. Get the chance to meet with and get advice from the experts in home design and purchase products at special prices!

title: Lisiecki Performs Mozart
description:
ARTS + CULTURE, ENTERTAINMENT, MUSIC


Praised for his "pristine, lyrical and intelligent" playing (The New York Times), Jan Lisiecki returns to perform Mozart’s elegant and effervescent piano concerto. Prokofiev’s Fifth Symphony is filled with grand, sweeping, lyrical music tinged with brooding introspection.

title: History Uncorked: Mirror Ball
description:
COMMUNITY, ENTERTAINMENT, NIGHTLIFE


Meet us under the mirror ball for History Uncorked on Friday, March 7, 2025! Get ready for glamour and good vibes at this year’s event, which will include dazzling entertainment, activities, and refreshments across six floors of award-winning exhibitions!

title: Vermiglio
description:
ARTS + CULTURE, ENTERTAINMENT, FILM & MOVIES


The lush and breathtaking beauty of the Alps, filmed with painterly grace under natural light from frigid winter to redemptive spring, provides the physical and emotional backdrop for ‘,’ Maura Delpero’s visionary film, which won the Silver Lion at the 2024 Venice Film Festival.

title: Liza: A Truly Terrific Absolutely True Story
description:
ARTS + CULTURE, ENTERTAINMENT, FILM & MOVIES


This star studded tribute brings into focus the dazzling, complex period of Liza Minnelli’s life starting in the 1970s, just after the tragic death of her mother Judy Garland—as she confronts a range of personal and professional challenges on the way to becoming a bona fide legend.

title: Kraftwerk: Multimedia Tour 2025 – 50 Years of Autobahn
description: ENTERTAINMENT, MUSIC

title: Movie Mobile: Speed
description:
ENTERTAINMENT, TOURS


The Burgh Bus's first screening event on the bus will be a special presentation of the 90s action movie classic… “SPEED” ??

title: Bracket Night Planned Parenthood of Western PA Benefit
description:
ARTS + CULTURE, COMMUNITY, ENTERTAINMENT


An interactive comedy game show benefiting Planned Parenthood of Western Pennsylvania!

title: Disney on Ice: Mickey’s Search Party
description:
ENTERTAINMENT, FAMILY


Join Mickey Mouse and his Disney friends on adventures filled with world-class skating, high-flying acrobatics, and unexpected stunts!

title: Workbox - PPG Place Grand Opening Celebration!
description:
COMMUNITY, FREE EVENT


Join Workbox for the official ribbon cutting and open house!

title: Ballet Folklórico de México
description:
ARTS + CULTURE, ENTERTAINMENT


Immerse yourself in the vibrant traditions & infectious rhythms of México!

title: One-on-one Irish Genealogy Sessions
description:
COMMUNITY, FAMILY, WORKSHOPS & CLASSES


If you are tracing your ancestors in Ireland, a face-to-face consultation with Irish Genealogy experts Fintan Mullan or Gillian Hunt could save you a considerable amount of time and greatly increase your chances of success.

title: Ben Seidman in Good Charlatan
description:
ARTS + CULTURE, ENTERTAINMENT


Good Charlatan dives into the world of con artistry, pickpocketing, and real magic. The show is a hilarious and profoundly beautiful plunge into the underworld of those who use and abuse the powers of deception.

title: Creative Conversations — Kimberly Akimbo
description:
ARTS + CULTURE, WORKSHOPS & CLASSES


Join Trust Arts Education for a pre-show chat on Wednesday nights with members from the company (schedule permitting) hosted by local theatre professionals to learn insights into the show you can’t find in your playbill.

title: Kimberly Akimbo
description:
ARTS + CULTURE, ENTERTAINMENT


The 2023 Tony-winner for best musical, based on David Lindsay-Abaire's play of the same title, revolves around a teenage girl named Kimberly Levaco, who suffers from a condition that rapidly accelerates the aging process. Before she has had a chance to venture forth into the world as an adult, she finds herself turning into an old woman.

title: Irish Genealogy Workshop
description:
ARTS + CULTURE, WORKSHOPS & CLASSES


Discover the history of your ancestors at the . Irish genealogy experts Fintan Mullan and Gillian Hunt from the Ulster Historical Foundation in Belfast are back after a one-year hiatus for the tenth annual , presented in partnership with the Westmoreland Historical Society, on March 4.

title: Tubby Daniels
description:
ARTS + CULTURE, ENTERTAINMENT, MUSIC


The  Band consists of four members,  on the vibraphone, Dennis Gardner on drums, Chuck Anderson on bass, and Victor Garzotto on piano.

title: Sugarcane Spectrum: A Curated Cocktail Taster Flight!
description:
COMMUNITY, ENTERTAINMENT


Join us for an exclusive evening celebrating the diverse world of sugarcane spirits!

title: The High Kings and Mary Black
description:
ARTS + CULTURE, ENTERTAINMENT, MUSIC


The High Kings are Finbarr Clancy, Darren Holden, Brian Dunphy Paul O’ Brien. The High Kings formed in June 2007 when Brian, Darren, Finbarr and former member Martin Furey were asked to join a brand new Irish ballad group by David Kavanagh after he had noticed a gap in the market for a band specialising in traditional Irish music.

title: Visit The Old Allegheny County Jail and Museum
description:
FREE EVENT, TOURS


Take a free trip!

title: Pixar in Concert
description:
ARTS + CULTURE, ENTERTAINMENT, MUSIC


Step into the enchanting world of Pixar magic as the Pittsburgh Symphony performs iconic film scores including Toy Story, Coco, Ratatouille, Cars, and many more, blending live music with cinematic visuals for a celebration that captures the hearts of children and adults alike.

title: Your ACT with Nonsense
description:
ARTS + CULTURE, ENTERTAINMENT, NIGHTLIFE


Tonight, the A.C.T. stage is yours! Bring your improv teams, sketch group, or stand-up act for an open mic-style show where the lineup is created on the spot. A perfect opportunity for artists to try something new in a short set and for audiences to see some experimental and cutting edge comedy.

title: Balliamo! Italy in Motion
description:
ARTS + CULTURE, WORKSHOPS & CLASSES


Discover the cultural tapestry of storytelling through dance. Join the Italian American Program and Allegro Dance Company for an immersive Italian dance experience. Learn regional dances from across Italy, from the north to the south, step-by-step and discover the stories behind each movement.

title: Penguins vs. Maple Leafs
description:
ENTERTAINMENT, SPORTS + RECREATION


Cheer on the Pittsburgh Penguins as they take on the Toronto Maple Leafs!

title: Pixar in Concert
description:
ARTS + CULTURE, ENTERTAINMENT, MUSIC


Step into the enchanting world of Pixar magic as the Pittsburgh Symphony performs iconic film scores including Toy Story, Coco, Ratatouille, Cars, and many more, blending live music with cinematic visuals for a celebration that captures the hearts of children and adults alike.

title: Irony City: Am I the Jagoff?
description:
ARTS + CULTURE, ENTERTAINMENT, NIGHTLIFE


Join veteran comedy troupe Irony City as they deftly navigate social missteps on the first Saturday each month.

title: Admit One: A Storytelling Experience
description:
ARTS + CULTURE, ENTERTAINMENT, NIGHTLIFE


Stand-up comedy is all about finding the funny in everyday life. Usually, it doesn’t matter if what you’re saying is true as long as it’s hilarious. ‘Admit One’ gives you, the audience, the chance to call comedians out! You’ll hear four riotous tales, and it’ll be your job to figure out if the comic is spitting truth or spreading lies!

title: World Oddities Expo 2025
description: Come on out at the World Oddities Expo, an amazing event specially created for the lovers of the strange and unusual. Visit our website to learn more!

title: Penguins vs. Bruins
description:
ENTERTAINMENT, SPORTS + RECREATION


Cheer on the Pittsburgh Penguins as they take on the Boston Bruins!

title: Ashley Cooke
description:
ENTERTAINMENT, MUSIC, NIGHTLIFE


Watch country music singer  perform live on her Your Place Tour!

title: Jurassic Quest 2025
description:
CONVENTION, FAMILY


The whole family will have fun at Jurassic Quest, the greatest dinosaur adventure featuring dozens of life-size animatronic dinosaurs! Get the chance to see how life on Earth once was! Please visit the website for more information and tickets!

title: SIGCSE Technical Symposium 2025
description:
CONVENTION, WORKSHOPS & CLASSES


The SIGCSE Technical Symposium addresses problems common among educators working to develop, implement and/or evaluate computing programs, curricula, and courses. The symposium provides a forum for sharing new ideas for syllabi, laboratories, and other elements of teaching and pedagogy, at all levels of instruction.

title: Oscar Nominated Shorts: Documentary
description:
ARTS + CULTURE, ENTERTAINMENT, FILM & MOVIES


Catch this year's most spectacular DOCUMENTARY short films and cast your prediction of the victor for a chance to win fabulous prizes!

title: Oscar Nominated Shorts: Live Action
description:
ARTS + CULTURE, ENTERTAINMENT, FILM & MOVIES


Catch this year's most spectacular LIVE ACTION short films and cast your prediction of the victor for a chance to win fabulous prizes!

title: Oscar Nominated Shorts: Animation
description:
ARTS + CULTURE, ENTERTAINMENT, FILM & MOVIES


Catch this year's most spectacular ANIMATION short films and cast your prediction of the victor for a chance to win fabulous prizes!

title: Pittsburgh Winter Wine Fest
description:
COMMUNITY, FESTIVAL, MARKET SQUARE


Pittsburgh's official and largest winter wine festival! Enjoy two floors of wine, music, and food all INDOORS!

title: Comedy Bus Tour
description:
ENTERTAINMENT, NIGHTLIFE, TOURS


Get ready for a sightseeing tour like no other! Hop aboard the Burgh Bus where the laughter never stops. Enjoy stunning skyline views and hilarious local comedians!

title: Who's Afraid of Virginia Woolf?
description:
ARTS + CULTURE, ENTERTAINMENT


It’s all fun and games until the one and only Edward Albee picks up his pen. His 1962 masterpiece WHO’S AFRAID OF VIRGINIA WOOLF? is a caustic cocktail of razor-sharp dialogue and electrifying performances that has kept audiences coming back for another round for decades.

description:

When a candle flickers, love sparks. Set against the backdrop of 1830’s Paris,  follows four impoverished artists surviving with little more than friendship, passion, and their love for art.
